item.title: Electrical Engineering Expert (Category II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The purpose is to support border security and surveillance through increasing institutional capacity of relevant border guards (currently Turkish Land Forces) and modernization of border surveillance system and to make contribution to the prevention of illegal migration, human trafficking, cross-border crimes, and smuggling and to ensure further development and implementation of border management and standards in line with EU’s IBM policies and strategies.

Project location: Ankara with visits to the Turkish Greek border

Electrical Engineering Expert (Category II)

Qualifications and skills

  • At least University degree in electrical engineering;
  • Good command of written and spoken English;
  • Knowledge of Turkish language will be an asset.

General Professional Experience

Minimum 3 years of professional working experience.

Specific Professional Experience

Experience on underground electricity power lines and/or underground electricity and data cabling, preferably at least 2 years.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Francesca_Giordano@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Team Leader: Border Surveillance Expert (Cat.I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The purpose is to support border security and surveillance through increasing institutional capacity of relevant border guards (currently Turkish Land Forces) and modernization of border surveillance system and to make contribution to the prevention of illegal migration, human trafficking, cross-border crimes, and smuggling and to ensure further development and implementation of border management and standards in line with EU’s IBM policies and strategies.

Team Leader: Border Surveillance Expert (Cat.I)

Qualifications and skills

  • At least Master’s degree in computer or electrical and electronics engineering; or in its absence, professional experience of minimum 17 years in the relevant sector(s);
  • Good command of written and spoken English;
  • Knowledge of Turkish will be an asset.

General Professional Experience

Minimum 12 years of professional working experience.

Specific Professional Experience

  • Experience in IT and/or ICT Systems, preferably at least 5 years;
  • Experience in border surveillance systems, preferably at least 2 years;
  • Project management experience and/or experience in preparation of a technical specifications document and market research document related to IT (Information Technology) and/or ICT (Information and Communication Technology) and/or Surveillance Systems hardware and/or software systems in accordance with the PRAG rules in minimum 1 EU funded project will be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Francesca_Giordano@dai.com

item.title: Human Rights Expert – Category III
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The EU Delegation has provided technical support to CHRC since 2012 to enhance its training capacity and the Committee has thus far been able to provide a number of provincial human rights training and create its provincial human rights focal points in 16 out of 25 provinces of Cambodia. The Committees will thus need to provide further training to its focal points in the remaining 09 provinces of Cambodia.

Project location: Phnom Phen with trainings in provinces (Ratanakiri, Mondulkiri, Koh Kong, Preah Vihear and Oddor Meanchey)

Human Rights Expert – Category III (42 man days)

  • At least 3 years of progressively responsible experience in human rights and comprehensive knowledge of a broad range of international human rights issues with particular experience in formulating human rights policy and strategies in the area of education and in organising and delivering training activities.
  • Advanced degree (master’s degree or equivalent), in law preferably in the field of conflict resolution, international human rights law, political science or international relations;
  • 1 year experience in designing and implementing a national human rights curriculum or human right training;
  • Good interpersonal relationship skill and be able to collaborate in a diplomatic manner with public bodies, civil society, political parties and the international community in a politically sensitive environment;
  • Working experience in countries with a developing democratic system;
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a multicultural setting, and as a team player;
  • Proven organisational, analytical and writing skills;
  • Previous experience in Cambodia is a distinctive advantage;
  • Proficiency in English, knowledge of French and/or Khmer an asset;
  • Computer proficiency (major currently used software and web-based tools).

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Francesca_Giordano@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Nutrition Experts with EU and African Experience and Expertise in Geospatial Mapping, M&E, Reviews/Assessments/Reforms
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The specific objectives of this consultancy assignment are:

  • To support the development of a national inventory of existing nutrition interventions in Malawi;
  • To support the EDF National Authorising Office (NAO) and the European Union Delegation to the Republic of Malawi (EUD) in identifying relevant 11th EDF support to the nutrition sector in Malawi.

Three Nutrition Experts with EU and African Experience and Expertise in Geospatial Mapping, M&E, Reviews/Assessments/Reforms Team Leader (Category I) (43 working days) Two Category II Experts (36 working days):

  • Master’s Degree or equivalent in nutrition or in a discipline relevant to the nutrition sector. Extra years of experience would be acceptable instead of a Master’s Degree. A senior expert (category I) without a Master’s degree would require relevant professional experience of minimum 15 years;
  • extensive knowledge and experience in nutrition sector related issues, including successful experience of at least (for the TL) 10 years in sector reviews/assessments, sector reforms and preparation of programmes, with at least 5 years within the Sub-Saharan African region;
  • should be able to demonstrate strong analytical skills; experience in conducting geospatial mapping and analysing Geographical Information Systems (GIS) data is an advantage;
  • strong analytical skills of developments in the context of sectors related to nutrition (e.g. food security, agriculture, epidemiology, health, sanitation etc.);
  • comparative country experience in formal and non-formal nutrition sub-sectors, particularly experience in crosscutting Primary, Secondary, and Tertiary Level education; nutrition service delivery (frontline staff training) and research development in sub-sector analysis, including analysis and measures to strengthen the links between professional skills development, evidence based information generation and the market and to promote involvement of the private sector and Non State Actors (NSAs) in the sector;
  • sound monitoring and evaluation, data analysis and/or statistical analysis expertise;
  • extensive knowledge of applied information technology, including database design and management (preferably linked to GIS and web-based applications), coupled with comparative country experience in organisational dynamics at public sector level, preferably in Sub-Saharan Africa;
  • sound knowledge of EU procedures and aid modalities;
  • must have comparative country experience in successfully mainstreaming cross cutting issues such as gender and environment. Additional expertise on HIV/AIDS, climate change, human rights and good governance is an added advantage.
  • The Team Leader must have sound management skills and must demonstrate that (s)he has successfully managed a team of minimum 3 people for at least 2 years.
  • fully computer literate, with good personal and communication skills; excellent skills in spoken and written English. Knowledge of Chichewa is an advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Francesca_Giordano@dai.com

When submitting your tailored CV, please highlight how you answers to each of the above specific requirements.

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Expert in Environmental/Waste Management Acquis, Compliance and SEA
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The global objective of the assignment is to ensure, economically and socially sound and viable development of Montenegro in a long-term perspective with special focus on waste management with a view of promoting sustainable development.

The main objective is to provide a high level of protection of the environment, incorporating environmental considerations in the development (preparation and adoption) of plans and programs. These should be a systematic decision support process of evaluating the environmental consequences, on but not limited to land degradation, air quality, surface and ground water quality, in order to ensure they are fully included and appropriately addressed at the earliest appropriate stage of decision-making on par with economic and social considerations. Details on SEA are defined under the Directive 2001/42/EC. As a consequence, a SEA process is mandatory for waste management plans.

Senior Expert in Environmental/Waste Management Acquis, Compliance and SEA

Qualifications and skills:

  • Education of at least Master degree in the field of environmental and/or biotechnical, technical sciences, law, spatial planning, economy, or equivalent professional experience of at least 15 years in the field of environmental and waste management legislation, chemistry, spatial planning;
  • Excellent written and oral knowledge of English language.

General professional experience:

Minimum 12 years of experience in the relevant field that encompasses the following:

  • Design, development and/or implementation of environmental and/or waste management policies and strategies,
  • Support to national authorities in the implementation of environmental and waste management policies in line with EU acquis.

Specific professional experience :

To have at least 5 years' work experience in the following fields relevant for this assignment:

  • EU environmental and waste management acquis. Drafting of legal acts and transposition of EU environmental acquis into national legislative frameworks;
  • Assessing of environmental compliance through comparison of national, international and EU environmental and waste management legislation;
  • Having been engaged as expert on at least two projects related to preparation of the Strategic Environmental Assessments (SEA).

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Spécialiste en réforme du foncier rural (catégorie I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Qualifications et compétences : • diplômé de l'enseignement supérieur (bac + 5) ou Masters ou équivalent.

Expérience professionnelle générale : • L'expert(e) aura au moins douze (12) ans d'une expérience internationale dans le développement rural dont 5 ans dans le domaine du foncier rural dans les pays émergents et/ou en voie de développement. • Il/Elle possèdera une bonne connaissance/expérience pratique des techniques et méthodologies/procédures éprouvées dans la mise en œuvre de cadastres ruraux. • Il/Elle possèdera une bonne connaissance/expérience pratique des produits attendus et des délais nécessaires à leur production à la fin de la procédure.

Expérience professionnelle spécifique : • l'expert(e) possèdera une expérience significative comme, chef de projet ou conseiller technique dans le domaine du foncier rural. • Une expérience dans la proposition et/ou la mise en œuvre de réformes dans le domaine du foncier rural. et en particulier dans le foncier rural en Afrique. • Une expérience professionnelle dans une administration publique en Afrique est un atout. • Une connaissance de l'administration ivoirienne est un atout supplémentaire. • Connaissances linguistiques : l'expert s'exprimera et rédigera parfaitement en français

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicolas_fichers@dai.com

item.title: Spécialiste en appui institutionnel et gestion de finances publiques, (catégorie I ; chef de mission)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Qualifications et compétences : o diplômé de l'enseignement supérieur (bac + 5) ou Masters ou équivalent.

Expérience professionnelle générale : o L'expert(e) aura au moins douze (12) ans d'une expérience diversifiée en diagnostic/audit/analyse institutionnelle et diagnostic/audit/analyse des finances publiques. o Il/Elle possèdera une expérience et/ou une connaissance approfondie de l'administration publique en Afrique et de son mode de fonctionnement. o Il/Elle possédera une connaissance de la modalité d'aide “Appui Budgétaire ”. o Il/Elle possèdera une aptitude particulière au partage d'expérience.

Expérience professionnelle spécifique : o L'expert(e) possèdera une expérience en analyse/évaluation, organisation et renforcement des capacités institutionnelles d'organismes publics et parapublics et d'évaluation des systèmes, des processus et des institutions de gestion de finances publiques.. o Une expérience dans la préparation d'un appui budgétaire est un avantage. o Une expérience professionnelle dans une administration publique en Afrique sub-saharienne est un atout. o Une connaissance de l'administration ivoirienne est un atout supplémentaire. o Connaissances linguistiques : l'expert s'exprimera et rédigera parfaitement en français

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicolas_fichers@dai.com

item.title: Project Evaluation Specialist
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The overall objective of this assignment is to conduct a Mid-term Review (MTR) in order to assess the overall progress of the Capacity Development for National Authorising Officer’s Support Unit Programme in Malawi. The primary purpose of the requested MTR is to assess to what degree the expected results of the programme have been achieved to date and draw lessons for the remaining period of implementation. The specific criteria to be used by the MTR is analysing the overall project performance against the results anticipated in the FA and the Logical Framework in line with standard EC evaluation methodology.

Project Evaluation Specialist (23 working days – 15 in Lilongwe and 8 home-based)

  • At least a Master’s Degree in political or social science, law, economics or a related field;
  • At least 12 years’ experience in a relevant sector;
  • Very good knowledge of EU procedures and EU-ACP cooperation;
  • Minimum 8 years’ experience in analytical work, evaluations and program management;
  • Previous experience in evaluation of similar programs;
  • Specific knowledge of institutional assessment and human resource management;
  • Very good knowledge of Cotonou Agreement and the role of the National Authorising Officer;
  • Good understanding and knowledge of the social and political realities in Sub-Saharan Africa
  • Excellent written and spoken English, as well as excellent communication skills.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to [Francesca_Giordano.@dai.com]

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Technical Transmission Senior Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The overall objective of the telecom infrastructure project is to upgrade the telecommunication infrastructure by developing a supplementary telecommunication network that will be suitable for the market conditions of northern part of Cyprus and in line with the European Union standards. As such, it aims to set up an Internet Protocol (IP) based type of infrastructure, similar to the systems being employed by the leading communications providers in different countries in the European Union. This type of all-IP based networks is called Next Generation Networks (NGN) and can be used to provide different types of services (internet, telephony) using the same infrastructure.

Specific objectives

  • To provide the beneficiary with daily support and with know-how for operating the NGN solution in a sustainable way.

  • To provide the Contracting Authority with further assurance that the supplies delivered are: o properly used and kept in good conditions by the beneficiary; o properly supported and maintained by the supplier with a view to the delivery of Final Acceptance Certificate (FAC).

  • To provide the Contracting Authority with information about the running NGN solution with a view to the delivery of the Final Acceptance Certificate.

Technical transmission senior expert

Education:

  • University degree in relevant fields such as telecommunications, computer science,electrical engineering, electronics, etc.
  • Training and/or certification on the installation and provisioning of transmission network elements, including DWDM (Dense Wavelength Division Multiplexing) and SDH (Synchronous Digital Hierarchy).
  • Training and/or certification in OSI (Open System Interconnection) routing and network payload protocols.
  • Training and/or certification on installation and provisioning of Microwave Radio Systems.

Professional experience: Minimum requirement:

  • At least 10 years of professional experience in telecommunications sector

Preferably:

  • Professional experience as a Manager or Team Leader in wire and/or wireless broadband and/or IP telecommunications networks in either of the below: 1) Operation / Maintenance department 2) Network Management Centre.
  • Professional experience with Element Managers (EMs) including connectivity to network nodes on core and transmission parts.
  • Professional experience, including configuration, testing, provisioning and troubleshooting with the following nodes: Ericsson Optical Multi Service family and Ericsson Multihaul 3000 Product and Ericsson Mini Link products family or with their equivalent from other manufacturers.
  • Professional experience in operating and/or troubleshooting wire and/or wireless broadband telecommunication networks. Professional experience in operating and/or troubleshooting WiMax solutions. Specific experience on NetSpan WiMax would be of an advantage.
  • Professional experience, as operational field manager, responsible for troubleshooting and repair of wire and/or wireless transmission network faults.
  • Professional experience in performing audits (including producing test procedures and using software based test tools) on networks.
  • Professional experience on Ericsson ServiceOn Element Manager (SO-EM).

Specific knowledge: Minimum requirement:

  • Very good knowledge of English

Preferably:

  • Knowledge of ITU-T standards (International Telecommunication Union telecom network standards).

Working language The working language is English.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to[ chloe_messenger@dai.com]

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Technical IP Network senior expert (Team Leader)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The overall objective of the telecom infrastructure project is to upgrade the telecommunication infrastructure by developing a supplementary telecommunication network that will be suitable for the market conditions of northern part of Cyprus and in line with the European Union standards. As such, it aims to set up an Internet Protocol (IP) based type of infrastructure, similar to the systems being employed by the leading communications providers in different countries in the European Union. This type of all-IP based networks is called Next Generation Networks (NGN) and can be used to provide different types of services (internet, telephony) using the same infrastructure.

Specific objectives

  • To provide the beneficiary with daily support and with know-how for operating the NGN solution in a sustainable way.
  • To provide the Contracting Authority with further assurance that the supplies delivered are: o properly used and kept in good conditions by the beneficiary; o properly supported and maintained by the supplier with a view to the delivery of Final Acceptance Certificate (FAC).
  • To provide the Contracting Authority with information about the running NGN solution with a view to the delivery of the Final Acceptance Certificate.

Technical IP Network senior expert (Team Leader)

  • University degree in relevant fields such as telecommunications, computer science,electrical engineering, electronics, etc..

  • Training and/or certification on Ericsson MPBN (Mobile Packet Backbone Network) or on equipment of similar functionality from other manufacturer (e.g. Cisco equivalent training for IP/MPLS (Internet Protocol/Multi-Protocol Label Switching) and IP Networking and IP Quality of Service).

  • Training and/or certification on EDA 2500 MSANs (Multi Service Access Nodes).

  • Training and/or certification on Redback router products.

  • Training and/or certification on Juniper firewall products.

  • Training and/or certification on one or more of the following: Ericsson IP Technology and/or CCNA (Cisco Certified Network Associate) and/or CCNP (Cisco Certified Network Professional) and/or equivalent IP technology from other vendor(s).

Professional experience: Minimum requirement:

  • At least 10 years of professional experience in telecommunications sector

Preferably:

  • Professional experience as a Manager or Team Leader in wire and/or wireless broadband and/or IP telecommunications networks in either of the below: 1) Operation / Maintenance department 2) Network Management Centre. Professional experience on Ericsson Broadband Access Nodes (EDA portfolio). Specific experience on EDA 2500 MSANs would be of an advantage.
  • Professional experience on Ericsson Redback routers products.
  • Professional experience on general enterpris firewalls products. Specific experience on Juniper firewalls products would be of an advantage.
  • Professional experience on Ericsson NetOp EMS & PM and Ericsson ServiceOnElement Manager (SO-EM).
  • Professional experience with IP and Ethernet technologies including configuration,testing, provisioning and troubleshooting of routers and switches.
  • Professional experience in operating and/or troubleshooting NGN telecommunication solutions or IP-based telecommunication networks.
  • Professional experience in performing audits (including producing test procedures and using software based test tools) on all-IP based networks.
  • Professional experience in operating and/or troubleshooting network with IMS / MTAS technology.

Specific knowledge: Minimum requirement:

  • Very good knowledge of English

Preferably:

  • Working knowledge of IETF (Internet Engineering Task Force) and their RFC’s (Requests for Comments) standards.
  • Working knowledge of TCP/IP, Unix/Linux, Shell scripting.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to [chloe_messenger@dai.com]

item.title: Legal expert (category II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The team will assist the Ministry of Energy and Coal Industry of Ukraine in the process of development of the Plan for emission reduction in line with the requirements of and in coordination with the Energy Community Secretariat and the European Commission as well as to support the Ministry of Energy and Coal Industry of Ukraine and other relevant stakeholders in the process of implementation of the EU-funded budget support operation “Continued support for the implementation of Ukraine’s energy strategy” in its part related to the implementation of the LCP Directive.

Legal expert (category II)

Qualifications and Skills

• University degree, preferably in law, energy, environment, economics;

• Fluent English;

• Knowledge of Ukrainian or Russian would be an asset;

General Professional Experience

• At least 6 years of experience in energy or environment as a lawyer;

*Specific Professional Experience *

• Knowledge of the EU acquis in the areas covered by the Terms of Reference;

• Knowledge of Ukrainian legislative process and Ukrainian legislation in the areas covered by these Terms of Reference;

• Practical experience in transposition of EU energy and/or environmental acquis in Ukrainian legislation.

Number of working days: 20

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to [http://nicolas_fichers@dai.com]

item.title: Monitoring and Evaluation Lead
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Innovation for Indonesia’s School Children (INOVASI) will provide necessary resources to help the Government of Indonesia (GoI) achieve a breakthrough in improving student learning by generating evidence of tailored solutions to locally prevailing challenges and promoting the adaptation and replication of these tested strategies to influence both policy and practice. The impact of INOVASI will be accelerated progress towards improving learning outcomes for Indonesian students.

INOVASI is designed to be transformational by investigating what works and what doesn’t work to get teachers teaching better and students learning more, and why, in order to leverage Indonesia’s substantial spend in education. It is not designed to be a program for directly delivering educational services. It will be transformational by:

  • Understanding local challenges and opportunities to improving student learning outcomes by bringing together key government and non-government stakeholders.
  • Generating evidence of what works and what does not work to improve student learning in Indonesian classrooms by trialing and testing local solutions (tested strategies).
  • Sharing this evidence with stakeholders in target and non-target districts to promote adaptation and replication of tested strategies in target and non-target districts.

INOVASI will work closely with GoI (district, provincial and national) to develop and implement action-oriented research.

Monitoring and Evaluation Lead

  • Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Social Sciences (International Development), Business Administration, Economics or other related fields;
  • Minimum 5-7 years of relevant professional experience, including 3 years in a long-term M&E position with an international donor-funded development project/organization;
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in application of the logical framework approach, Performance Monitoring Plan development, and environmental assessment and impact monitoring;
  • Extensive experience of donor performance management schemes, knowledge of DFAT M&E processes desirable.
  • Experience with tracking the impacts of public-private partnerships (attribution of results, cost-sharing, etc);
  • Experience in participatory design (outcome mapping, after action review, structured interviews, focus groups, case studies, surveys, and secondary data analysis techniques);
  • Excellent command of survey design, data collection and data management, and data analysis using rigorous statistics and appropriate software;
  • Experience with innovative handheld and online data collection systems; and
  • Experience with economic development programs and gender mainstreaming.
  • Ability to explain M&E processes to staff and partners and ensure that they adhere to the highest standards of quality, relevance and timeliness in their M&E efforts;
  • Strong analytical skills and ability to write clear reports;
  • Ability to explain highly technical results to non-technical audiences;
  • Fluent in English
  • Working knowledge of Bahasa Indonesian an advantage

The program is planned as an eight-year initiative, to be implemented in two four-year phases. This proposal concerns the first four-year project phase. The estimated start date would be January 2015.

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting DFAT/AOP/008 in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Innovation for Indonesia’s School Children (INOVASI) will provide necessary resources to help the Government of Indonesia (GoI) achieve a breakthrough in improving student learning by generating evidence of tailored solutions to locally prevailing challenges and promoting the adaptation and replication of these tested strategies to influence both policy and practice. INOVASI is designed to be transformational by investigating what works and what doesn’t work to get teachers teaching better and students learning more, and why, in order to leverage Indonesia’s substantial spend in education.   • Sharing this evidence with stakeholders in target and non-target districts to promote adaptation and replication of tested strategies in target and non-target districts.

INOVASI will work closely with GoI (district, provincial and national) to develop and implement action-oriented research.

Senior Gender Advisor

  • University degree in a relevant subject, such as development.
  • Five (5) years’ experience developing and managing international development programs for women.
  • Additional experience with education preferred.
  • Prior experience working on DFAT programs an advantage.
  • Excellent management and administrative skills.
  • Flexibility and willingness to travel to different districts/provinces to complete program assignments.
  • Experience in human rights and environmental issues an advantage.
  • Fluency in English required. Working knowledge of Bahasa Indonesian an advantage.

The program is planned as an eight-year initiative, to be implemented in two four-year phases. This proposal concerns the first four-year project phase. The estimated start date would be January 2015.

Innovation for Indonesia’s School Children (INOVASI) will provide necessary resources to help the Government of Indonesia (GoI) achieve a breakthrough in improving student learning by generating evidence of tailored solutions to locally prevailing challenges and promoting the adaptation and replication of these tested strategies to influence both policy and practice.   • Understanding local challenges and opportunities to improving student learning outcomes by bringing together key government and non-government stakeholders.
  • Generating evidence of what works and what does not work to improve student learning in Indonesian classrooms by trialing and testing local solutions (tested strategies).
  • Sharing this evidence with stakeholders in target and non-target districts to promote adaptation and replication of tested strategies in target and non-target districts.

INOVASI will work closely with GoI (district, provincial and national) to develop and implement action-oriented research.

Senior Advisor on Innovation in Education

  • University degree in a relevant field (e.g. international development, education) and proven experience in translating complex ideas from various fields into unified, clear guidance.
  • At least 6 years of professional experience in the field of innovation & social entrepreneurship, with some education experience.
  • Experience in project development and budgeting.
  • Understanding of open-source thinking.
  • Understanding of linkages between programme and policy creation.
  • Demonstrated experience working with policy makers and technologists to create successful results in any field.
  • Ability to integrate different experiences, methodologies, and approaches from a diverse range of stakeholders, organisations, and technical experts from multiple sectors.

item.title: Deputy Team Leader,
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Innovation for Indonesia’s School Children (INOVASI) will provide necessary resources to help the Government of Indonesia (GoI) achieve a breakthrough in improving student learning by generating evidence of tailored solutions to locally prevailing challenges and promoting the adaptation and replication of these tested strategies to influence both policy and practice. The impact of INOVASI will be accelerated progress towards improving learning outcomes for Indonesian students.

INOVASI is designed to be transformational by investigating what works and what doesn’t work to get teachers teaching better and students learning more, and why, in order to leverage Indonesia’s substantial spend in education. It is not designed to be a program for directly delivering educational services. It will be transformational by:

  • Understanding local challenges and opportunities to improving student learning outcomes by bringing together key government and non-government stakeholders.
  • Generating evidence of what works and what does not work to improve student learning in Indonesian classrooms by trialing and testing local solutions (tested strategies).
  • Sharing this evidence with stakeholders in target and non-target districts to promote adaptation and replication of tested strategies in target and non-target districts.

INOVASI will work closely with GoI (district, provincial and national) to develop and implement action-oriented research.

Deputy Team Leader, Innovation for Indonesia’s School Children (INOVASI)

Role: The Deputy Team Leader will oversee all operational functions of the program – ensuring compliance with all DFAT and DAI rules and regulations.

Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):

  • All operations including but not limited to administration, logistics, procurement, budgeting, financial, and property.
  • Ensuring that program implementation is in accordance with DFAT regulations and procedures and the specifications determined in the project Service Order.
  • Assuring that the most reasonable, fair, expeditious and appropriate procurement choices were made pursuant to DAI’s Procurement Guide.
  • Supervision of DAI’s day‐to‐day field presence in the areas of operations (including the project’s facilities such as office space, equipment and project vehicles), administration, logistics, procurement, budgeting and financial accounting and act as the Team Leader when he/she is absent from the program.
  • Supervision of the daily financial operations of the contract, which include cash flow management, time sheet recording, reporting to DAI on the financial aspects of the project, and daily monitoring of obligations, budgets, and expenditures.
  • Ensuring continuous liquidity for the project, including handling all human resource issues and investigating and identifying new ways of achieving project efficiencies.

Qualifications:

EDUCATION BA in Political Science, International Development, or related field preferred

WORK EXPERIENCE

  • Relevant work experience, including experience with a Contractor or international NGO managing an office or program.
  • At least 5 years of experience working on donor‐funded projects in a related role and with some demonstrated supervisory experience.
  • Experience working in developing countries is required, preferably in the Asia-Pacific region. Experience of working in Indonesia will be an advantage.

SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE

  • Demonstrated experience and knowledge in establishing systems and overseeing program start‐up under limited time constraints.
  • Human resources and adviser management, especially in recruitment; logistics and procurement; capacity building and training; financial management, budgeting and reporting.
  • Excellent verbal and written English skills.
  • Working knowledge of Bahasa Indonesian an advantage.

The program is planned as an eight-year initiative, to be implemented in two four-year phases. This proposal concerns the first four-year project phase. The estimated start date would be January 2015.

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application to sarah_owen@dai.com quoting DFAT/AOP/008 in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

item.title: Communications for Development (C4D) Advisor
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Innovation for Indonesia’s School Children (INOVASI) will provide necessary resources to help the Government of Indonesia (GoI) achieve a breakthrough in improving student learning by generating evidence of tailored solutions to locally prevailing challenges and promoting the adaptation and replication of these tested strategies to influence both policy and practice. The impact of INOVASI will be accelerated progress towards improving learning outcomes for Indonesian students.

INOVASI is designed to be transformational by investigating what works and what doesn’t work to get teachers teaching better and students learning more, and why, in order to leverage Indonesia’s substantial spend in education. It is not designed to be a program for directly delivering educational services. It will be transformational by:

  • Understanding local challenges and opportunities to improving student learning outcomes by bringing together key government and non-government stakeholders.
  • Generating evidence of what works and what does not work to improve student learning in Indonesian classrooms by trialing and testing local solutions (tested strategies).
  • Sharing this evidence with stakeholders in target and non-target districts to promote adaptation and replication of tested strategies in target and non-target districts.

INOVASI will work closely with GoI (district, provincial and national) to develop and implement action-oriented research.

Communications for Development (C4D) Advisor

  • Degree level qualification or equivalent, in a communications related subject (C4D, journalism etc) or social science
  • At least 5 years’ experience working in the field of communications and ability to demonstrate knowledge of a broad range of communications activities – media, websites, publications, marketing, social media, events, etc.
  • Minimum 3 years of practical experience in behavior change, communication or outreach in various development sector programs.
  • Experience working with e-communications, including preparing and sending E-Bulletins, supporter updates, Appeals, etc.
  • Proven and demonstrable experience of editing and producing publications.
  • Experience in the design, planning, implementing and evaluating of C4D campaigns across a range of communication channels (e.g. working with websites, including web development, producing content for the web, etc.
  • Capacity to develop individual and organizational capacity linking to sustainable approaches
  • Computer literate with good MS Office Skills.
  • Excellent writing skills.
  • Fluency in English
  • Working knowledge of Bahasa Indonesian an advantage

The program is planned as an eight-year initiative, to be implemented in two four-year phases. This proposal concerns the first four-year project phase. The estimated start date would be January 2015.

If you meet the criteria and would like to be considered for this nominated role please email your CV with a covering note outlining how you fit the requirements. Please email your application sarah_owen@dai.com quoting DFAT/AOP/008 in the subject line of your email.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

item.title: Senior Expert in Development Policy/International Relations (TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Objectives

The main objectives of the assignment are:

to analyse the results from the OECD/DAC special review on Croatia and prepare an action plan on how to address the recommendations identified by this review for the Division for International Development Cooperation and Humanitarian Assistance in the Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs of Croatia.

to provide consultancy and advisory services in relation to the following topics:

  • how to centralize development assistance by strengthening a whole-of-government approach;
  • how to integrate the Aid Effectiveness (AE) and Policy Coherence for Development (PCD) agenda at an early stage in development policy and implementation;
  • Country aid programming: how to programme bilateral aid for Croatia’s top aid recipient - Bosnia and Herzegovina and assist in the development of a Country Programme for Bosnia and Herzegovina;
  • how Croatia can eventually participate in EU Joint Programming and if so, in which countries;
  • how Croatia can match its capacities and experience to eventually expand operations into Sub-Saharan Africa;
  • how Croatia’s expertise can be put to use via a mapping of the EU’s external aid instruments and their beneficiaries;
  • A multiannual strategy: how to prepare a multiannual Strategy for Development Cooperation and Humanitarian Assistance;
  • private sector dialogue: how to develop further cooperation with and integrate the private sector in Croatia’s development policy;
  • communication and visibility: how to communicate development assistance policy and help build Croatia’s visibility as a donor;

to provide specific training services to the Croatian International Development Unit and their inter-ministerial Committee on Development Cooperation and Humanitarian Aid.

Senior Expert in Development Policy/International Relations (TL)

Overall responsibility; a strand in development policy, proven professional experience in development policy issues and international relations.

The team-leader is not expected to work full-time on this assignment but to provide consultancy services to the beneficiaries as required.

Requirements:

  • A Masters’ degree in a field relevant to the assignment (such as Development Economics or Political Science) is required together with 10 years of professional experience or, in the absence of a
  • Masters’ degree, at least 12 years of professional experience.
  • Excellent drafting, editing and communication skills in English are essential.
  • Working knowledge of Croatian would be an advantage.

The experts will participate in maximum six (6) meetings in Brussels and in Croatia or other EU Member States as necessary.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Senior Environment and Biology Expert (Category I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The Expert 2 is expected to contribute the implementation of all of the related modules and the preparation of both training materials and Training Evaluation Report in the context of related chapter/s.

Qualifications and skills:

  • Master’s degree in Biology, Ecology, Chemistry or other Natural Sciences related to assignment. In the absence of the degree required, at least 17 years of professional experience in the related areas is requested.
  • Good command of both written and spoken English.
  • General professional experience
  • At least 12 years of experience in the sector(s) related to the Lot.

Specific professional experience:

  • At least 3 years of experience in technical and/or scientific fields required for the implementation of the Water Framework Directive and/or Habitat Directive and/or other related Directives.
  • At least 2 river basin management plans experience in terms of setting of environmental objectives and/or setting, design and upgrade of biological monitoring programme and/or execution and assessment of biological monitoring.
  • Experience in development of measures for water pollution reduction and/or improving ecological status, and/or river basin characterisation/analysis will be an asset.
  • Experience in projects related to Integrated Water Resources Management will be an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Agnese_Ortolani@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS
